author: Staff Reporter
text:
Over the last three years, 250 to 289 lives were annually claimed by road accidents in Coimbatore city. “While efforts taken by the police have resulted in a drop in such deaths in 2015, we are trying to bring it below 200 deaths,” the Deputy Commissioner of Police (Traffic) for city N. Sivakumar said.

He was addressing students at the valedictory of the 27{+t}{+h}road safety awareness week at Sri Krishna College of Engineering and Technology, at Kovaipudur, on Tuesday. A series of awareness drives and programmes were organised by the police and transport departments during the observance that began on January 10.

The Deputy Commissioner said that ignorance, negligence and laziness were among the main causes of accidents.

He stressed the need to follow rules and regulations and make it part of personal ethics. He also gave away prizes to the winners of various competitions that were organised as part of the observance. A road safety oath was also administered as part of the programme.

Officials from the transport and police departments were also present at the valediction..
title: Efforts on to bring down accidents: DCP
